title: Capacitor - flux through S from C and Delta V

content.question: A parallel-plate capacitor of capacitance <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math> has a potential difference <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> between its plates. Surface <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> is located halfway between, and has the same area as the plates. What is the electric flux through Surface <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="epsilon sub 0, times C delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator epsilon sub 0, times delta V, and denominator C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mi>C</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator C delta V, and denominator epsilon sub 0, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta V, and denominator C epsilon sub 0, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>C</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator C delta V, and denominator epsilon sub 0, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
